tasks.title: Child sees their personal task list on the kiosk page
tasks.description:
**User Story:** As a child using the family tablet, I want to see my tasks in a clear, simple list, so that I know exactly what I need to do without being overwhelmed.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- WHEN the kiosk page loads for a child THEN the app SHALL display only tasks assigned to that child
- WHEN displaying tasks THEN the app SHALL show each task title in large, readable text
- WHEN tasks are displayed THEN the list SHALL be read-only with no editing controls visible
- WHEN viewing the task list THEN the layout SHALL be optimized for tablet landscape mode
- WHEN displaying interactive elements THEN touch targets SHALL be at least 44x44 pixels

tasks.title: Controls to switch between children are integrated into the task view
tasks.description:
**User Story:** As a child using the family tablet, I want to easily switch to see my tasks (not my sibling's) without navigating to a separate screen, so that the experience is quick and seamless.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- WHEN the kiosk page loads THEN child selector controls (avatars or tabs) SHALL appear on the side or above the task list
- WHEN a child taps a different child's avatar/tab THEN the app SHALL immediately switch to show that child's tasks
- IF there is only one child in the family THEN the child selector controls SHALL be hidden
- WHEN viewing the task list THEN the currently selected child SHALL be visually indicated
- WHEN switching children THEN no page navigation SHALL occur (integrated experience)

tasks.title: Tasks are ordered fairly so no task feels stuck at the bottom
tasks.description:
**User Story:** As a child, I want my tasks to be ordered fairly, so that I do not always see the same boring task at the bottom of my list.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- WHEN tasks are displayed THEN higher priority tasks SHALL appear before lower priority tasks
- IF multiple tasks have the same priority THEN the app SHALL randomize their order on each page load
- IF a task has no priority defined THEN the app SHALL treat it as lowest priority
- WHEN the page is refreshed THEN tasks with equal priority MAY appear in a different order

tasks.title: Child can check off a completed task
tasks.description:
**User Story:** As a child, I want to check off a task with one tap, so that completing tasks feels quick and I can move on to the next one.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- WHEN viewing my task list THEN each task SHALL have a clearly visible checkbox or completion button
- WHEN I tap the checkbox THEN the task SHALL be marked as completed in the system
- WHEN a task is completed THEN it SHALL no longer appear in my task list
- IF I accidentally check off a task THEN there is no undo (simplicity over recoverability for children)
- WHEN checking off a task THEN no confirmation dialog SHALL appear (one-tap completion)

tasks.title: Completing a task feels satisfying with visual feedback
tasks.description:
**User Story:** As a child, I want to see a satisfying animation when I complete a task, so that checking things off feels rewarding and fun.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- WHEN I check off a task THEN the task SHALL fade out or dissolve before disappearing
- WHEN the animation plays THEN it SHALL complete within 500ms (not too slow)
- WHEN the animation finishes THEN the remaining tasks SHALL smoothly fill the gap
- IF the browser does not support animations THEN the task SHALL simply disappear (graceful degradation)

tasks.title: Child sees a celebratory message when all tasks are completed
tasks.description:
**User Story:** As a child, I want to see a fun celebration when I finish all my tasks, so that I feel proud and motivated.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- WHEN a child has no pending tasks THEN the app SHALL display a celebratory achievement message
- WHEN showing the celebration THEN the app SHALL display a large, friendly emoji (e.g. star, trophy, party)
- WHEN showing the celebration THEN the message SHALL be in German (e.g. "Super gemacht!" or "Alle Aufgaben erledigt!")
- WHEN showing the celebration THEN the message SHALL make the child feel accomplished and proud
- IF the child switches to their view and has no tasks THEN the celebration SHALL appear immediately
